[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Outbreak Management (OM) defines requirements to support investigation, monitoring, analysis, and containment of public health events.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: OM facilitates data collection, case management, exposure tracing, and integration with laboratory and surveillance systems for effective health response.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: OM integrates with laboratory systems, surveillance tools, and countermeasure platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: OM provides dashboards and electronic questionnaires for investigators and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: OM is compatible with desktop and mobile devices used in field investigations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: OM supports APIs for interoperability with partner systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: OM uses encrypted protocols to ensure secure data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: OM is optimized for large dataset processing and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: OM ensures 24/7 availability with failover mechanisms during system outages.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: OM is configurable for various public health jurisdictions and emergency responses.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: OM links to external data repositories for outbreak tracking and evaluation.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: OM supports outbreak investigation, case linkage, exposure tracing, and epidemiological reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for public health investigators, laboratory personnel, and system administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: OM depends on compatible infrastructure and stable network connectivity.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: OM requires integration with laboratory and surveillance systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Outbreak: Public health event requiring intervention.
Case: Subject under investigation for disease transmission.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with laboratory systems for test result sharing.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall exchange surveillance data with external monitoring tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate epidemiological reports using aggregated data (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide user-friendly dashboards and interactive forms.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall offer configurable templates for structured data entry.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process case updates within 5 seconds (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall handle up to 500 concurrent users efficiently.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store case, contact, and laboratory data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall implement role-based access control and version management.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular architecture for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The database shall comply with PHIN security guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to PHIN vocabulary and data standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 security protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically to accommodate additional users and outbreaks.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and audit all critical actions for compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional validation, performance benchmarks, and compliance testing with PHIN standards.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training materials, and best practices for outbreak management.
[SEC] 5. References: PHIN guidelines, ISO 27001 documentation, and epidemiological reporting frameworks.
